Key Arguments: The legislation would allow the government to control and censor information on the internet.
It is antithetical to free speech, which is essential in a democracy.
The government has previously controlled public opinion during the COVID-19 pandemic through censorship.
The bill could be used to suppress dissenting views on various issues like climate change, the Voice referendum, and LGBTQI+ rights.
The government would become the arbiter of truth, leading to a totalitarian regime.
Notable Quotes: This is antithetical to the idea of free speech that is essential in a democracy.
The government will effectively become the arbiter of truth and Australia will become a totalitarian regime not dissimilar to North Korea or the former USSR.
This bill is antithetical to free speech and the free transfer of ideas and information which is crucial to the survival of the Australian democracy.
